title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ando@maslab.aitech.ac.jp. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. title: Field-Collected Data of Green Foxtail
text: Setaria viridis (green foxtail, ネコジャラシ) common weed. package contains measurements individual branches wild Setaria viridis plant collected near author’s home. dataset intended practicing basic data analysis techniques. ’s ideal learning calculate basic descriptive statics, create visualizations histograms scatter plots, gain experience data manipulation exploration using R. relatively small size straightforward structure make dataset easy work beginners data analysis.

title: Field-Collected Data of Green Foxtail
text: can install setariaviridis using following methods:

title: Field-Collected Data of Green Foxtail
code: # Enable the R-universe options(repos = c(   nononoexe = "https://nononoexe.r-universe.dev",   cran = "https://cloud.r-project.org" ))  # Install the package install.packages("setariaviridis")

title: Field-Collected Data of Green Foxtail
text: data package comprises measurements Setaria viridis collected author around home Aichi Prefecture, Japan.  data obtained August 2021 hand-harvesting Setaria viridis plants, root , dense population. Measurements plant part taken manually using tape measure ruler.  data can accessed follows: want see info: ?setaria_viridis data contains 54 branches across 10 Setaria viridis plants. Setaria viridis consists 4 parts: panicle, leaf, culm, root, illustrated figure :  Data sharing roots can identified root_number. measurement items, please refer following figure understand parts measured:
code: library(setariaviridis) data(package = "setariaviridis") head(setaria_viridis) #>   root_number culm_length panicle_width panicle_length leaf_number #> 1           1        69.3           2.0            6.9           1 #> 2           1        49.5           1.3            4.2           3 #> 3           1        49.1           1.8            6.5           4 #> 4           1        47.0           1.7            5.1           4 #> 5           1        51.3           2.0            5.9           5 #> 6           2        51.6           1.9            5.8           3

what: Size measurements for Setaria viridis — setaria_viridis
title: Size measurements for Setaria viridis — setaria_viridis
text: dataset contains measurements various parts attributes branch Setaria viridis. variables described follows:

title: Size measurements for Setaria viridis — setaria_viridis
Size measurements for Setaria viridis — setaria_viridis
text: data frame 54 rows 5 variables: root_number factor indicating branches share root. culm_length Numeric. Length culm ground, measured centimeters (cm). panicle_width Numeric. Width panicle, measured centimeters (cm). panicle_length Numeric. Length panicle, measured centimeters (cm). leaf_number Integer. Number leaves side branch.
